titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jacques Guicharnaud Papers
titlestmt.author: by Karen Spicher

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 04:23

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Jacques Guicharnaud Papers consist of correspondence with literary and teaching colleagues, publishers, family, and friends; autograph manuscript and typescript drafts of plays, literary criticism, and other writings; a small amount of drafts and offprints of literary criticism by colleagues; syllabi, lecture notes, and administrative papers relating to teaching at Yale University and Harvard University; printed material including theater programs and clippings relating to theater in France and the United States; and a small amount of financial records, photographs of colleagues, family, and play productions, and other papers. Most materials date from Guicharnaud's career in the United States; some correspondence and writings from his studies and early career in France are also present. Research strengths include Guicharnaud's writings and teaching career, French theater, and criticism and teaching of French literature in the United States, 1950s-1990s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from the estate of Jacques Guicharnaud on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2005.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Jacques Guicharnaud Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jacques Guicharnaud Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of materials formerly classed as Uncat MSS 826. In 2005, the collection received a preliminary level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization. A preliminary finding aid was compiled from lists created at the time of receipt by the Library. Folder titles were based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles were not verified against the contents of folders. In 2007-2008, the preliminary finding aid was revised to comply with current archival descriptive standards.

In 2012, the collection received a baseline level of processing, including rehousing and reorganization. The collection was reclassed and organized into series, folder titles were revised, and containers were renumbered. Most folder titles in the Correspondence series were updated to conform with Library of Congress name authorities. Some writings were listed by uniform title; most were listed in alphabetic groupings based on forms of titles appearing in the collection.

bioghist.head: Jacques Guicharnaud (1924-2005)
bioghist.p: Jacques Guicharnaud, Benjamin F. Barge Professor Emeritus of French at Yale University, scholar of French theater, and specialist in French literature and drama of the 17th, 18th, and 20th centuries. Guicharnaud was born in Paris, where he was a student during the German occupation in World War II. During the 1940s, he was associated with existentialist philosphers Jean-Paul Sartre, Albert Camus, and Simone de Beauvoir. In 1949, he emigrated to the United States to teach at Bryn Mawr College. Guicharnaud taught at Yale from 1950 to his retirement in 1997, with the exception of an appointment at Harvard University during 1977-1979. At Yale, he was acting master of Jonathan Edwards College, 1968 spring, and Morse College, 1972-1973, and he served on the executive committee of the Yale Theater Studies Program. His writings on French literature include Modern French Theatre From Giraudoux to Beckett , coauthored with June Beckelman (1961) and Molière: une aventure théâtrale: Tartuffe, Don Juan, Le misanthrope (1963). He also wrote and translated plays for theater and television, and coauthored a novel, Santarém , with Yale University history professor Rollin G. Osterweis (1959). He was married to June Beckelman Guicharnaud (1922-1989), an author, editor, and translator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jacques Guicharnaud Papers consist of correspondence with literary and teaching colleagues, publishers, family, and friends; autograph manuscript and typescript drafts of plays, literary criticism, and other writings; a small amount of drafts and offprints of literary criticism by colleagues; syllabi, lecture notes, and administrative papers relating to teaching at Yale University and Harvard University; printed material including theater programs and clippings relating to theater in France and the United States; and a small amount of financial records, photographs of colleagues, family, and play productions, and other papers. Most materials date from Guicharnaud's career in the United States; some correspondence and writings from his studies and early career in France are also present. Research strengths include Guicharnaud's writings and teaching career, French theater, and criticism and teaching of French literature in the United States, 1950s-1990s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, circa 1945-circa 2005. II. Writings, 1943-circa 1997. III. Writings by Others, circa 1950-circa 1997. IV. Teaching Materials, circa 1950-circa 1997. V. Printed Material, circa 1950-circa 2005. VI. Other Papers, circa 1950-circa 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes letters from Henri Peyre, Sterling Professor of French Emeritus at Yale University; other colleagues and students; publishers; and a few letters from early literary associates including Albert Camus, Jean Cocteau, and Jean-Paul Sartre. Correspondence with publishers concerns Guicharnaud's writings, with some accompanying drafts, contracts, and royalty statements. Most letters are incoming, with a small amount of outgoing drafts and typescript carbons.

did.unittitle: France, Ambassade (U.S.). Services du conseiller culturel
Nobel Committee of the Swedish Academy
Société des auteurs et compositeurs dramatiques

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Notebooks, arranged chronologically, followed by undated; Plays, arranged alphabetically by title; and Other Writings, arranged alphabetically by title, followed by unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Most writings are plays, including works by Guicharnaud in French, English translations of his plays, and French translations by Guicharnaud of plays by others. Notebooks contain drafts of plays, unidentified writings, and diary entries dated 1943-1945, 1947-1948, and 1952-1956. Other Writings contain correspondence, publicity materials, and reviews relating to Modern French Theatre From Giraudoux to Beckett , by Guicharnaud and June Beckelman, and Molière: une aventure théâtrale ; research materials relating to Santarém , a novel by Guicharnaud and Rollin G. Osterweis; and drafts of essays on literary criticism, book reviews, novels, stories, and poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains Claudel, Paul, Partage de midi (play). Manuscript copy made by Guicharnaud in 1943

unittitle.title: Modern French Theatre From Giraudoux to Beckett
Molière: une aventure théâtrale: Tartuffe, Don Juan, Le misanthrope
Portrait du Français d'après les romans de Henry James

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: By Guicharnaud and Rollin G. Osterweis

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by author, followed by unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts, offprints, and photocopies of literary criticism by colleagues.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of institution, followed by unidentified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials include syllabi and lectures for courses taught by Guicharnaud, faculty correspondence, and memoranda. Papers relating to Yale University, Jonathan Edwards College, concern budgeting, event programming, and other administrative work by Guicharnaud as acting master during spring, 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains mostly clippings about French and American theater. Unarranged material includes programs from productions of Le Théâtre Français de Yale, the Yale Dramatic Association, and the Yale School of Drama Repertory Theatre.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by topic, followed by clippings and unarranged material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Financial papers concern taxes, insurance and expenses. Some invoices and receipts may relate to Yale University, Jonathan Edwards College. A small amount of photographs consists of images of colleagues, play productions, and unidentified family, possibly including Guicharnaud.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material.
